tokenactionhud.title: Token Action HUD
tokenactionhud.handlerNotFound: not found, reverting to core roller.
tokenactionhud.filterTagExplanation: Add entries here to show or hide specific category entries.
tokenactionhud.categoryTagExplanation: Add and remove additional customisable categories.
tokenactionhud.subcategoryTagExplanation: Add and remove subcategories: enter free-text for macro subcategories or select linked compendiums.
tokenactionhud.settings.rollHandler.name: HUD roll handler
tokenactionhud.settings.rollHandler.hint: Choose which module will receive the HUD's actions.
tokenactionhud.settings.enabledForUser.h: If enabled, the HUD is active for the user. Does not override the player permission setting.
tokenactionhud.settings.onTokenHover.hin:
If enabled, the HUD will appear when hovering over a controllable token.
Warning: Due to the unpredictable position of a token on the canvas, some actions may fall off the screen.
tokenactionhud.settings.playerPermission: If enabled, players will be able to use the HUD.
tokenactionhud.settings.debug.name: Enable debugging
tokenactionhud.settings.debug.hint: Enable debug logging. (This has sort of fallen by the wayside, don't expect it to be very useful)
tokenactionhud.settings.scale.hint: Adjust the scale of the HUD in percentage terms (100 being the default)
tokenactionhud.settings.scale.name: HUD scale
tokenactionhud.settings.dropdown.name: Dropdown Categories
tokenactionhud.settings.dropdown.hint: If enabled, sets categories to drop down, otherwise uses a (warning!) half-assed drop-up implementation. Feel free to report any bugs.
tokenactionhud.settings.renderItemOnRigh: If enabled, right-clicking on an item in the HUD will bring up the item's sheet (possibly conflicts with other settings that use right-click).
tokenactionhud.settings.alwaysShowHud.hi: If the user has an assigned character, the HUD will default to this character when no token is selected.
tokenactionhud.settings.showHudTitle.hin: Prints a title above the HUD, normally the selected token's alias.
tokenactionhud.settings.alwaysShowAdditi: If enabled, custom categories will be shown even when no token is selected.
tokenactionhud.settings.showIcons.name: Show action icons
tokenactionhud.settings.showIcons.hint: If enabled, the action image will be displayed on the HUD button where available.
tokenactionhud.settings.clickOpenCategor: If enabled, categories will open on click instead of hover.
tokenactionhud.settings.dnd5e.ignorePass: If enabled, passive feats are not shown.
tokenactionhud.settings.dnd5e.showSpellI: If enabled, spell component information, concentration, and ritual status will be noted next to the spell name.
tokenactionhud.settings.dnd5e.showAllNon: If disabled, spells such as cantrips, innate, pact, and at-will spells need to be 'prepared' via the spell details to be shown on the HUD.
tokenactionhud.settings.dnd5e.hideLonger: Hide actions with an activation longer than 1 round
If enabled, actions with longer activation types (minutes, hours, or days) are not shown.
tokenactionhud.settings.dnd5e.abbreviate: If enabled, skills and abilities will use a three-character abbreviation.
tokenactionhud.settings.dnd5e.splitAbili: Show separate ability check and save categories
If enabled, abilities will be separated into checks and saves.
tokenactionhud.settings.dnd5e.showAllNpc: If enabled, all items are shown for NPCs, not just equipped items.
tokenactionhud.settings.dnd5e.showEmptyI: Show empty items (includes items and spells)
If enabled, items are shown in the HUD even if they have no remaining charges.
tokenactionhud.settings.dnd5e.itemMacroR: Item-Macro: item macro, original item, or both
Select which of the items will be shown in the inventory.
tokenactionhud.settings.dnd5e.showCondit: If enabled, the HUD will present a category showing the available token conditions and status effects normally available in the regular Token HUD.
tokenactionhud.settings.sw5e.ignorePassi: If enabled, passive feats are not shown.
tokenactionhud.settings.sw5e.hideLongerA: Hide actions with an activation longer than 1 round
If enabled, actions with longer activation types (minutes, hours, or days) are not shown.
tokenactionhud.settings.sw5e.abbreviateS: If enabled, skills and abilities will use a three-character abbreviation.
tokenactionhud.settings.sw5e.showEmptyIt: Show empty items (includes items and powers)
If enabled, items are shown in the HUD even if they have no remaining charges.
tokenactionhud.settings.pf2e.showPcAbili: If enabled, PCs will also have an Abilities category on their HUD.
tokenactionhud.settings.pf2e.separateTog: If enabled, rule toggles will be placed in their own category, otherwise they will fall under strikes.
tokenactionhud.settings.pf2e.showNpcAbil: If enabled, NPCs will also have an Abilities category on their HUD.
tokenactionhud.settings.pf2e.calculateAt: If enabled, strikes will show their calculated attack bonus (attack bonus - MAP) instead of the flat MAP.
tokenactionhud.settings.pf2e.printSpellC: If disabled, left-clicking a spell will roll attack (shift right-click for bonus dialogue), right-clicking will roll damage (ctrl right-click for bonus dialogue). If neither are applicable, the spell card will be printed to chat anyway.
tokenactionhud.settings.pf2e.abbreviateS: If enabled, skills and abilities will use a three-character abbreviation.
tokenactionhud.settings.pf2e.ignorePassi: If enabled, passive actions are not shown.
tokenactionhud.settings.pf2e.showOldNpcS: If enabled, the HUD will show the old NPC strike actions as well as the new (experimental) strikes for NPCs.
tokenactionhud.settings.sfrpg.showSpellI: If enabled, spell resistance, dismissible, concentration and save information noted next to the spell name.
tokenactionhud.settings.sfrpg.showMiscFe: If enabled, features with no assigned action type will be shown in a catch-all, miscellaneous category.
tokenactionhud.settings.dungeonworld.sho: If enabled, and if the user is a GM, the HUD bar will include GM moves, treasure rollable-tables, and charts.
tokenactionhud.settings.swade.abbreviate: If enabled, skills and abilities will use a three-character abbreviation.
tokenactionhud.settings.itemMacroReplace: Show both original item and item macro item
